intro: Terminalia kumpaja, commonly known as the Kumpa tree, is a deciduous tree native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Thailand, Malaysia, and Indonesia. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its rough, fissured bark and elongated, lance-shaped leaves. The tree produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by woody, oval-shaped fruits containing a single seed. Its botanical features make it an important species in traditional medicine and local ecosystems.
